thread.title: Texas hospital patients may be in for surprise on bills
thread.title_full: Texas hospital patients may be in for surprise on bills - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Texas hospital patients may be in for surprise on bills
text:
Photo: Steve Gonzales, Staff Image 1 of / 47 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 47 Kathy Holtwick has spent many hours on the phone trying to fight a surprise $29,000 bill for an air ambulance. ﻿ Kathy Holtwick has spent many hours on the phone trying to fight a surprise $29,000 bill for an air ambulance. ﻿ Photo: Steve Gonzales, Staff Image 2 of 47 All of Kathy Holtwick's treatment was covered except the air ambulance. That bill arrived for $29,000. She is fighting the charge, hoping for some relief.﻿

To answer that question, we sifted through a trove of data on the federal government's Medicare website, and compiled a ranking based on patient surveys. See which local medical facility was scored the highest by Houstonians.
Source: Medicare

Patients who gave their ... more Photo: Google Maps Image 47 of 47 Texas hospital patients may be in for surprise on bills 1 / 47 Back to Gallery Even if critically sick patients are vigilant enough to choose a hospital approved by their insurance plan, many could face thousands of dollars in surprise medical bills because the physician who treated them was not part of the coverage.
A study shows it is happening at more than 300 Texas hospitals, including 15 in Houston, where not a single emergency room doctor is covered by one or more of the state's largest insurers - even if the hospital is.
"For patients it feels like bait and switch," said report author Stacey Pogue, senior policy analyst at the Austin-based Center for Public Policy Priorities.
Has this happened to you? Please contact jenny.deam@chron.com
Read the full story from reporter Jenny Deam on our subscriber site, HoustonChronicle.com .
